🚀 Attention Recruiters! 🚀As a fresher eager to break into the IT industry, I’ve been wondering: How important is a portfolio when hiring for entry-level IT roles? 🤔Here’s My Question for You:Do recruiters in IT see a portfolio as a must-have for freshers looking for roles in Development, Networking, Cybersecurity, or IT Support? Or, is it more about skills, certifications, and hands-on experience? 🧑‍💻💼Why I’m Asking:For technical roles (like development, networking, cybersecurity): I’ve heard that a portfolio showcasing projects, GitHub repos, or blogs can make a candidate stand out. But is it something you actively look for when evaluating applications? 💻For IT Support roles (like Help Desk or Service Desk): Does a portfolio hold less weight, and is it more about problem-solving and communication skills? Or do you still appreciate seeing real-world examples of a candidate’s work? 🔧Why It Matters:As someone who’s passionate about starting a career in IT, I want to give myself the best shot. Whether it’s creating a strong portfolio or focusing on gaining hands-on experience, I’d love to know what you, as a recruiter, value more in entry-level candidates.🤔 Recruiters, I’d love to hear from you:How important is a portfolio for an entry-level position in IT?What’s the one thing you wish freshers focused on more when applying for their first job?Looking forward to your insights! 🚀 Attention Recruiters! 🚀As a fresher eager to break into the IT industry, I’ve been wondering: How important is a portfolio when hiring for entry-level IT roles? 🤔Here’s My Question for You:Do recruiters in IT see a portfolio as a must-have for freshers looking for roles in Development, Networking, Cybersecurity, or IT Support? Or, is it more about skills, certifications, and hands-on experience? 🧑‍💻💼Why I’m Asking:For technical roles (like development, networking, cybersecurity): I’ve heard that a portfolio showcasing projects, GitHub repos, or blogs can make a candidate stand out. But is it something you actively look for when evaluating applications? 💻For IT Support roles (like Help Desk or Service Desk): Does a portfolio hold less weight, and is it more about problem-solving and communication skills? Or do you still appreciate seeing real-world examples of a candidate’s work? 🔧Why It Matters:As someone who’s passionate about starting a career in IT, I want to give myself the best shot. Whether it’s creating a strong portfolio or focusing on gaining hands-on experience, I’d love to know what you, as a recruiter, value more in entry-level candidates.🤔 Recruiters, I’d love to hear from you:How important is a portfolio for an entry-level position in IT?What’s the one thing you wish freshers focused on more when applying for their first job?Looking forward to your insights! ❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources

🚀 Attention Recruiters! 🚀As a fresher eager to break into the IT industry, I’ve been wondering: How important is a portfolio when hiring for entry-level IT roles? 🤔Here’s My Question for You:Do recruiters in IT see a portfolio as a must-have for freshers looking for roles in Development, Networking, Cybersecurity, or IT Support? Or, is it more about skills, certifications, and hands-on experience? 🧑‍💻💼Why I’m Asking:For technical roles (like development, networking, cybersecurity): I’ve heard that a portfolio showcasing projects, GitHub repos, or blogs can make a candidate stand out. But is it something you actively look for when evaluating applications? 💻For IT Support roles (like Help Desk or Service Desk): Does a portfolio hold less weight, and is it more about problem-solving and communication skills? Or do you still appreciate seeing real-world examples of a candidate’s work? 🔧Why It Matters:As someone who’s passionate about starting a career in IT, I want to give myself the best shot. Whether it’s creating a strong portfolio or focusing on gaining hands-on experience, I’d love to know what you, as a recruiter, value more in entry-level candidates.🤔 Recruiters, I’d love to hear from you:How important is a portfolio for an entry-level position in IT?What’s the one thing you wish freshers focused on more when applying for their first job?Looking forward to your insights! ❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources

❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources

🚀 Attention Recruiters! 🚀As a fresher eager to break into the IT industry, I’ve been wondering: How important is a portfolio when hiring for entry-level IT roles? 🤔Here’s My Question for You:Do recruiters in IT see a portfolio as a must-have for freshers looking for roles in Development, Networking, Cybersecurity, or IT Support? Or, is it more about skills, certifications, and hands-on experience? 🧑‍💻💼Why I’m Asking:For technical roles (like development, networking, cybersecurity): I’ve heard that a portfolio showcasing projects, GitHub repos, or blogs can make a candidate stand out. But is it something you actively look for when evaluating applications? 💻For IT Support roles (like Help Desk or Service Desk): Does a portfolio hold less weight, and is it more about problem-solving and communication skills? Or do you still appreciate seeing real-world examples of a candidate’s work? 🔧Why It Matters:As someone who’s passionate about starting a career in IT, I want to give myself the best shot. Whether it’s creating a strong portfolio or focusing on gaining hands-on experience, I’d love to know what you, as a recruiter, value more in entry-level candidates.🤔 Recruiters, I’d love to hear from you:How important is a portfolio for an entry-level position in IT?What’s the one thing you wish freshers focused on more when applying for their first job?Looking forward to your insights! ❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources

Data Scientist Intern🔹 Who is hiring? Lockheed Martin Corporation🔹 Where is the job located? Fort Worth, TX – at a designated Lockheed Martin facility🔹 Is it full-time or part-time? Part-time internship during Summer 2025🔹 What experience is required? Currently enrolled in a relevant Bachelor’s program (Engineering, Data Science, etc.)🚀 Ready to launch your career with Lockheed Martin?👉 Apply Now

🚀 Attention Recruiters! 🚀As a fresher eager to break into the IT industry, I’ve been wondering: How important is a portfolio when hiring for entry-level IT roles? 🤔Here’s My Question for You:Do recruiters in IT see a portfolio as a must-have for freshers looking for roles in Development, Networking, Cybersecurity, or IT Support? Or, is it more about skills, certifications, and hands-on experience? 🧑‍💻💼Why I’m Asking:For technical roles (like development, networking, cybersecurity): I’ve heard that a portfolio showcasing projects, GitHub repos, or blogs can make a candidate stand out. But is it something you actively look for when evaluating applications? 💻For IT Support roles (like Help Desk or Service Desk): Does a portfolio hold less weight, and is it more about problem-solving and communication skills? Or do you still appreciate seeing real-world examples of a candidate’s work? 🔧Why It Matters:As someone who’s passionate about starting a career in IT, I want to give myself the best shot. Whether it’s creating a strong portfolio or focusing on gaining hands-on experience, I’d love to know what you, as a recruiter, value more in entry-level candidates.🤔 Recruiters, I’d love to hear from you:How important is a portfolio for an entry-level position in IT?What’s the one thing you wish freshers focused on more when applying for their first job?Looking forward to your insights! ❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources

❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources

🚀 Attention Recruiters! 🚀As a fresher eager to break into the IT industry, I’ve been wondering: How important is a portfolio when hiring for entry-level IT roles? 🤔Here’s My Question for You:Do recruiters in IT see a portfolio as a must-have for freshers looking for roles in Development, Networking, Cybersecurity, or IT Support? Or, is it more about skills, certifications, and hands-on experience? 🧑‍💻💼Why I’m Asking:For technical roles (like development, networking, cybersecurity): I’ve heard that a portfolio showcasing projects, GitHub repos, or blogs can make a candidate stand out. But is it something you actively look for when evaluating applications? 💻For IT Support roles (like Help Desk or Service Desk): Does a portfolio hold less weight, and is it more about problem-solving and communication skills? Or do you still appreciate seeing real-world examples of a candidate’s work? 🔧Why It Matters:As someone who’s passionate about starting a career in IT, I want to give myself the best shot. Whether it’s creating a strong portfolio or focusing on gaining hands-on experience, I’d love to know what you, as a recruiter, value more in entry-level candidates.🤔 Recruiters, I’d love to hear from you:How important is a portfolio for an entry-level position in IT?What’s the one thing you wish freshers focused on more when applying for their first job?Looking forward to your insights! ❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources

🚀 Attention Recruiters! 🚀As a fresher eager to break into the IT industry, I’ve been wondering: How important is a portfolio when hiring for entry-level IT roles? 🤔Here’s My Question for You:Do recruiters in IT see a portfolio as a must-have for freshers looking for roles in Development, Networking, Cybersecurity, or IT Support? Or, is it more about skills, certifications, and hands-on experience? 🧑‍💻💼Why I’m Asking:For technical roles (like development, networking, cybersecurity): I’ve heard that a portfolio showcasing projects, GitHub repos, or blogs can make a candidate stand out. But is it something you actively look for when evaluating applications? 💻For IT Support roles (like Help Desk or Service Desk): Does a portfolio hold less weight, and is it more about problem-solving and communication skills? Or do you still appreciate seeing real-world examples of a candidate’s work? 🔧Why It Matters:As someone who’s passionate about starting a career in IT, I want to give myself the best shot. Whether it’s creating a strong portfolio or focusing on gaining hands-on experience, I’d love to know what you, as a recruiter, value more in entry-level candidates.🤔 Recruiters, I’d love to hear from you:How important is a portfolio for an entry-level position in IT?What’s the one thing you wish freshers focused on more when applying for their first job?Looking forward to your insights! ❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources

🚀 Attention Recruiters! 🚀As a fresher eager to break into the IT industry, I’ve been wondering: How important is a portfolio when hiring for entry-level IT roles? 🤔Here’s My Question for You:Do recruiters in IT see a portfolio as a must-have for freshers looking for roles in Development, Networking, Cybersecurity, or IT Support? Or, is it more about skills, certifications, and hands-on experience? 🧑‍💻💼Why I’m Asking:For technical roles (like development, networking, cybersecurity): I’ve heard that a portfolio showcasing projects, GitHub repos, or blogs can make a candidate stand out. But is it something you actively look for when evaluating applications? 💻For IT Support roles (like Help Desk or Service Desk): Does a portfolio hold less weight, and is it more about problem-solving and communication skills? Or do you still appreciate seeing real-world examples of a candidate’s work? 🔧Why It Matters:As someone who’s passionate about starting a career in IT, I want to give myself the best shot. Whether it’s creating a strong portfolio or focusing on gaining hands-on experience, I’d love to know what you, as a recruiter, value more in entry-level candidates.🤔 Recruiters, I’d love to hear from you:How important is a portfolio for an entry-level position in IT?What’s the one thing you wish freshers focused on more when applying for their first job?Looking forward to your insights! ❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources

🚀 Attention Recruiters! 🚀As a fresher eager to break into the IT industry, I’ve been wondering: How important is a portfolio when hiring for entry-level IT roles? 🤔Here’s My Question for You:Do recruiters in IT see a portfolio as a must-have for freshers looking for roles in Development, Networking, Cybersecurity, or IT Support? Or, is it more about skills, certifications, and hands-on experience? 🧑‍💻💼Why I’m Asking:For technical roles (like development, networking, cybersecurity): I’ve heard that a portfolio showcasing projects, GitHub repos, or blogs can make a candidate stand out. But is it something you actively look for when evaluating applications? 💻For IT Support roles (like Help Desk or Service Desk): Does a portfolio hold less weight, and is it more about problem-solving and communication skills? Or do you still appreciate seeing real-world examples of a candidate’s work? 🔧Why It Matters:As someone who’s passionate about starting a career in IT, I want to give myself the best shot. Whether it’s creating a strong portfolio or focusing on gaining hands-on experience, I’d love to know what you, as a recruiter, value more in entry-level candidates.🤔 Recruiters, I’d love to hear from you:How important is a portfolio for an entry-level position in IT?What’s the one thing you wish freshers focused on more when applying for their first job?Looking forward to your insights! ❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources

❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources

🚀 Attention Recruiters! 🚀As a fresher eager to break into the IT industry, I’ve been wondering: How important is a portfolio when hiring for entry-level IT roles? 🤔Here’s My Question for You:Do recruiters in IT see a portfolio as a must-have for freshers looking for roles in Development, Networking, Cybersecurity, or IT Support? Or do you still appreciate seeing real-world examples of a candidate’s work? 🔧Why It Matters:As someone who’s passionate about starting a career in IT, I want to give myself the best shot. Whether it’s creating a strong portfolio or focusing on gaining hands-on experience, I’d love to know what you, as a recruiter, value more in entry-level candidates.🤔 Recruiters, I’d love to hear from you:How important is a portfolio for an entry-level position in IT?What’s the one thing you wish freshers focused on more when applying for their first job?Looking forward to your insights! ❗Why is Manpower Planning needed?❗The importance of manpower planning can be explained with the help of the following ex.:Generally, a startup business starts with an idea of service/project. This startup receives the order & start working.Next, they start hiring people. First, they hire people for production & service. When the work expands, they hire marketing people & next they hire people for other departments such as accounts, quality department & customer care, etc.👉Now they have hired so many people but they ignored their competencies. They hired this manpower without proper planning. In the absence of planning, they found bad results.👉They found that cost has been increased & results are also poor. People are inefficient & not doing their job properly.2: 6 Step Process for Manpower PlanningThe process of manpower planning involves the following 6 steps:1. Identifying departments: First, identify various departments of your company.For eg, a manufacturing company will include the following departments:👉Purchase department👉Manufacturing department👉Quality department👉Dispatch department👉Sales department👉Marketing department👉HR departmentThese all are the departments of a manufacturing company. Similarly, you have to identify various departments of your company.2. Develop SOP: After listing all the departments for your company now have to prepare their SOP’s step by step.For example, SOP of purchase department involves:👉Requirement gathering👉Negotiate with vendors👉Create purchase order👉Receiving orderThis is a simple example of SOP. Similarly, you have to prepare SOP for all departments.3. Identifying competencies: Now, you have to understand your SOP and identify the work type. Identify the skills, attitudes & competencies that are required for this work. It will help you in selecting the right person for this work.For eg, in case of purchase following competencies are required:👉Experienced person👉Fresher person👉ClerkSimilarly, you have to identify competencies in each department of your company.4. Calculate monthly transactions: Now you have to calculate monthly transactions.5. Identify sub-steps & required time❗3 Benefits of Manpower PlanningFollowing are the benefits of manpower planning:👉Identify the manpower department wise: You will know how many people are required in each department. You will know about surplus/deficit manpower.👉Identify competencies4: Symptoms of surplus & deficit ManpowerFollowing are the symptoms of surplus manpower:👉Miscommunication because when a greater number of people might confuse.👉Extended lunch hours.👉Unnecessary discussion & gossips.👉Employees come late & leave early from office.Following are the symptoms of deficit manpower:👉Employees get less increment.👉Long working hours of employees.👉Work pressure.You should observe all these symptoms to understand the surplus/ deficit of your manpower.hashtag#humanresources
